data.title: My go to place for great food!
data.text: South Main Kitchen is our go to place because their consistency with great food is amazing. We are never disappointed whenever we eat there which is about 3 times a month. Try the brussel sprout appetizer, it is to die for!! The staff is very friendly and attentive.

data.title: It is one of the best
data.text: Some great food and even better service...be sure to check it out.  It is well worth the visit and be sure to learn about their sister restaurant too

data.title: Best chicken in the world...
data.text:
My wife and I had a week day lunch in this honky tonk looking restaurant on Main Street in Alpharetta's charming downtown.  The bare brick walls, exposed ducts and open rafters foretold the oh so typical hipster eating establishment.  
We were wrong; it was an dinning delight.  
We split their bib lettuces, blue cheese and bacon salad to start.  The house made dressing was creamy and the cheese flavor apparent but not overwhelming.  It's hard to wow me with a salad but this one was excellent and could have been my whole meal on an "eating light" day.  I had their chicken over collard greens, cubed potatoes, and baby organic carrots.  The flavors were a fall feast, the ingredients were first rate and the presentation was sublime.  A nearly perfect chicken dish, that's hard to do, but they pulled it off.  My wife had the steak sandwich with jalapeño  aioli.  The meat was perfectly prepared and the aioli was mainly flavor and only a little heat.  It was excellent.  
We finished with there seasonal sweet potato cheese cake.  It tasted like the first Thanksgiving would have tasted if the pilgrims had known anything about cheese cake.  The crust was a gluten free minced nuts and sugar combination.  I'm not gluten free but the crust shows how creative and clever pastry chefs have embraced this customer segment.  Great flavor and texture!  The cheese cake was light and gently flavored with sweet potato, more pumpkin-ish and nutmeg-ish than yam-ish.  Absolutely delicious.
Our waiter was quick and efficient and the manager was by twice to check on our selection and to discuss their focus on the best of the best of the season.  She was a wealth of information and a delight
Park in the back, there are lots of spaces.

BTW-For those of you who didn't watch HBO's Big Love series, the head line is a quote from the Lois character.

data.title: A Gem in Alpharetta
data.text: Just ate at South Main Kitchen in Alpharetta, Georgia.  The restaurant has a very cool vibe to it, our waiter, Alec, was exceptional, and the food was fantastic.  All four dishes we ordered were cooked to perfection. Give it a try, we'll be back!

data.title: Best chili!
data.text: The steak chili is amazing, and I do not even like beef! The food is fresh. The staff is friendly. The restaurant has a nice decor.

data.title: Sunday Brunch - Dinner
data.text: Sat upstairs outside for Sunday Brunch. Excellent food and service. Very cozy and another great place to watch people walk by.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Met up with friends tonight for dinner.  Sat outside at a lovely table in the alleyway.  Had a reservation and we were seated right away.  However, no one ever came to take our order - be our waiter.  They must've had a bad evening bc our friends said they've never had a bad experience.  The best thing we ate was the brussel sprouts.  OMGoodness - to DIE for.  But the hamburger was just ok.  It was overcooked - I'd asked for med well - it was well done.  My husband got the pork chop meal - quite pricey at $22.  His meal was overdone and cool - not warm at all.  They comped us two desserts bc the pork chop dinners (both men had them) were overcooked and cold.  But we had to remind them to take them off the bill.  Don't get me wrong - we will go back bc our friends swear to it that it's an awesome place.  We just hit it on the wrong night.

data.title: CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!
data.text: All I can say is eat here! Atmosphere was lights and inviting, service was beyond accommodating and friendly. Everything our table ordered was phenomenal! Custom cocktails and quality wine list. I recommend ordering appetizers:  the brussel sprouts with bacon and feta as well as the deviled eggs. The menu changes based on season so food is always fresh. I had the Red Snapper with quinoa and whipped avocado (fabulous!). The whole experience was memorable and I will definitely visit when I'm in town.

data.title: Worst Experience I have ever had!!
data.text: I made a reservation for lunch using their web page.  This was a Birthday lunch for a friend.  When we arrived, they said they had no reservation for us even though I had a confirmation number.  We were seated in the middle of the dining area.  Our table crammed next to a large party.  The ceiling was the trendy pipe/duct with no insulation.  There was absolutely no way we could hear each other talk.  The service was terrible and the food was awful.   We never got refills on our drinks and the wait staff never checked on us.

data.title: Delicious in every way
data.text: Such an interesting and delicious menu.  Lovely atmosphere, comfortable and casual. I've tried something different every time and have never been disappointed.

data.title: Amazing Dinner
data.text: Our first visit since they opened two years ago and glad we returned. First we had the Brussel sprout appetizer which was recommended by our server and we loved it. The two entrees, Pork Osso Buco and lamb pasta were outstanding and highly recommended. The drink and wine menu have good offerings as well. Service was quite good but it is a little noisy.

data.title: Scrumptious
data.text: The Brussel sprouts are absolutely delicious. I could make a meal out of them. We also had the meatballs and the kale salad. I could have licked my plate. The service was excellent. The decor very fun and inviting. And very reasonably priced for farm to table. I will definitely be back.

data.title: Good food; too loud
data.text: Have been twice, and really want to love this place as we live in town and like to support the local businesses.  The food is good, but the drinks are not generous. The prices are high, and the ambiance is lacking. The tables are too close together,  and it is always so loud it's impossible to hold a conversation.

data.title: Great night out!
data.text: I love this place! We sat at the bar, had a few drinks and a few appetizers. The bartender was fantastic and made our visit very enjoyable.

data.title: Their Osso Bucco is amazingly delicious
data.text: I always have the Osso Bucco as it I the bet I have ever had. It is fall-off the bone, juicy and tender and melt in your mouth goodness. I also love the variety of carrots that come with it. Absolutely yummy!

data.title: Excellent atmosphere and food & Drink.
data.text: Great service, Geno was awesome.  He really knew what he was doing.  Excellent Beer selection.  You must try the Brussels.  To die for.

data.title: Great food combinations! Awesome service! Cool location!
data.text: We went to this cool bar for lunch with  Edge! One of the CEO's of Edge raves about the place. He was not kidding great food and great drinks! Everyone ordered something different! We were all talking about what we ordered when the owner of the place came by our table! She was very nice! The food was amazing!! Everyone has great customer service! They have indoor and outdoor seating! From lunch to dinner this place has a little something for everyone! Great craft beers also!! Thank you to the owner and the staff of South Main Kitchen for making our afternoon a great one!

data.title: Delicious Lunch
data.text: Fantastic lunch sharing the Brussel sprouts, sweet potato fries, and Brisket Tacos.  Cool vibe and great service as well!

data.title: Such a cool restaurant and the food is GREAT!
data.text: Gotta love the fun downtown vibe of Alpharetta.  Who knew??? Kudos to the city for all the growth and for attracting top notch venues such as this restaurant.  Order the Brussel Sprouts appetizer - you won't be disappointed!

data.title: Good Food!
data.text: This was my first experience at South Main Kitchen. I arrived a little before 11:30 a.m. on a Friday and within 30 minutes the place had filled up for lunch. We started with the Brussels Sprout appetizer and it was delicious!!! Recommended by our waitress, it had bacon, feta cheese, roasted sprouts and a basil vinaigrette dressing....delicious and I don't generally like Brussels sprouts. My friend had the Club sandwich and I had the Shrimp Sandwich....both were delicious!! I would have enjoyed a little more shrimp in mine but it was still good. We had the Blackberry Peach Crisp with Black Pepper Vanilla Bean Ice Cream....so unusual but so creamy and delicious!! The décor is very nice....made to look like an old warehouse which it might have been. Wait staff was very attentive and gave us good service. I think I would enjoy dining there again whenever I am in the area.
